availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: A. S. Thompson (Calloway County, KY, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Calloway County, Kentucky farmer. Pennsylvania native. Married to Eliza J. Thompson. Father of Abraham Thompson, John Thompson, T. H. Wilcox Thompson, David Thompson, Elizabeth Thompson, Mary A. Thompson, and Louisa V. Thompson. Owned five enslaved people in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Calloway County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Calloway County in 1860. Farmer in Calloway County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, p. 400B.

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 2, p. 874.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, County, p. 235B.
